courses.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Preparation
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the procedural information and practical skills needed to be an effective undergraduate teaching assistant.  May be used as free elective credit with department approval.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Peer Tutoring
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the practical skills needed to be an effective peer tutor at Georgia Tech. May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Fundamentals of K-12 Tutoring
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the practical skills needed to be an effective tutor in the K-12 arena.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Research Assistantship
courses.description: Credit hours to be arranged.  Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Credit hours to be arranged.  Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.  May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

courses.title: Residence Life Seminar
courses.description: This course will provide students with techniques, skills and knowledge necessary to become a successful Residence Life Student Staff member.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Principles of Learning and Teaching I
courses.description: This course focuses on the knowledge and skills necessary for effective classroom instruction and management including: educational psychology, instructional design and delivery techniques.  May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

courses.title: Principles of Teaching and Learning II
courses.description: This course focuses on the knowledge and skills necessary for effective classroom instruction and management including instructional planning, assessment, and the teaching professional community.  May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

courses.title: Research Assistantship
courses.description: Credit hours to be arranged.  Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: May be used as free elective towards BS degrees with department approval.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of Current Interest.  May not be used towards degree requirements.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of Current Interest.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of Current Interest.  May not be used towards degree requirements.

courses.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Preparation
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the procedural information and practical skills needed to be an effective graduate teaching assistant.

courses.title: Classroom Management and Policies: Effective Teaching
courses.description: A course in which students learn about official Georgia Tech policies impacting instruction and develop skills to resolve problems and enhance classroom learning.

courses.title: Student and Teacher Enhancement Partnership Summer Training
courses.description: Participants attend training sessions on pedagogy, classroom management, educational technology; engage in practice teaching; and design action plans for partnering with local high school teachers.

courses.title: STEP Fellows Academic Year Seminar
courses.description: This is the academic year follow-up course for STEP fellows.  It is a forum to share and to continue training as the fellows work in their STEP high schools.

courses.title: Teaching and Learning in Higher Education
courses.description: This course explores how to apply evidence-based teaching practices in higher education including principles of learning, student development, inclusive teaching, and instructional strategies..

courses.title: Teach Practicum-HigherEd
courses.description: Apprentice to faculty mentor and help teach a college course.  Get feedback from mentor, CETL, and a peer learning community.  Explore types of academic careers.

courses.title: Teach Practicum-HigherEd
courses.description: Apprentice to faculty mentor and help teach a college course. Get feedback from mentor, CETL, and a peer learning community.  Explore types of academic careers.

courses.title: Course Design for Higher Education
courses.description: This course examines evidence-based teaching, formative and summative assessment, and educational technology as students apply the backward design process in developing a college course.

courses.title: Teaching Capstone in Higher Education
courses.description: Students apply evidence-based teaching and backward design principles, student assessment, peer and mentor feedback through supervised college teaching in this Tech to Teaching certificate capstone.

courses.title: Academic Writing for Graduate Students and
courses.description: Through examination of writing samples and practice, students learn techniques for enhancing proposal preparation and methods for evaluating writing as future instructors and thesis directors.

courses.title: Academic Writing for International Graduate Students
courses.description: This course aids international graduate students in enhancing their academic writing skills in English through exposure to, and practice of producing examples of academic writing. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8722 and CETL 8723.

courses.title: Academic Writing for International Graduate Students
courses.description: This course helps international graduate students enhance their academic writing skills in English through analysis and production of academic writing samples. Credit not awarded for both CETL 8723 and CETL 8722.

courses.title: Academic Professionalism
courses.description: Participants in this course work through numerous exercises and scenarios in order to prepare them professionally and personally for a future career in academics.

courses.title: Academic Presentations
courses.description: An examination and practice of oral presentations in a variety of academic scenarios: e.g., conference talks, proposal presentations, discussion facilitation, job talks, and oral exams/defenses.

courses.title: Instructional Practices for International
courses.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation and instructional skills for international teaching assistants.  In-class and small-group language practice; discussion of teaching methodology.

courses.title: Classroom English and Pedagogy for International
courses.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation and instructional skills for international teaching assistants.  In-class and small-group language practice; discussion of teaching methodology; individual tutoring.

courses.title: Oral Skills for International Graduate Students
courses.description: An oral skills class designed to help graduate students become more accurate and fluent in both verbal and nonverbal skills. In addition to working on acquiring an American accent and body language when speaking English, students will work on basic presentation skills. Credit will not be awarded for CETL 8793 and CETL 8797.

courses.title: Academic English for International Graduate Students
courses.description: Enhancement of English pronunciation for international teaching assistants.  In-class and small group language practice.

courses.title: Advanced Oral Skills for International Graduate Students and Teaching Assistants
courses.description: An advanced oral skills class designed to help graduate students improve their verbal ability in English for teaching, making presentations, and interacting in academic and professional situations. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8796 and CETL 8795.

courses.title: Presentation Skills for International Graduate Students
courses.description: This advanced oral skills class is designed to help graduate students improve their presentation skills in English for more effective communication in academic/professinal situations. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8795 and CETL 8796.

courses.title: Oral Communication for International Graduate Students
courses.description: In this class, students work on fluency, pronunciation clarity, and appropriateness in spoken communication to prepare for effective and confident participation in their academic communities. Credit will not be awarded for both CETL 8797 and CETL 8793.

courses.title: Special Problems
courses.description: Special problems in current interest.

courses.title: Student and Teacher Enhancement Partnership
courses.description: This course if for STEP students with an assistantship.
